definition: to be intensely proud of sth (idiom)

to draw (e.g. a bow)/to pull/to stretch sth/to extend/to lengthen/to involve or implicate in/to attract/to lead/to guide/to leave/to provide evidence or justification for/old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

sentences.english: Be honest, be tolerant, and lead a life you are pround of.
sentences.chinese: 诚实，宽容，过引以为傲的生活。

sentences.english: I’ve done much in my life that I’m not proud of.
sentences.chinese: 在我的生活中我做了许多我并不引以为傲的事情。

sentences.english: I’m very proud of my gold pocket watch.
sentences.chinese: 我对我的那块金怀表引以为傲。

sentences.english: The Chinese have long prided themselves on their traditional, Confucian reverence for the elderly.
sentences.chinese: 中国人长久以来对他们的儒家尊老的传统引以为傲。

sentences.english: Beijing has a great deal to be proud of.
sentences.chinese: 这些年北京做出来的大可引以为傲。

sentences.english: Two that have done investors proud are the yen and gold bullion.
sentences.chinese: 让投资者引以为傲的两类资产是日元和黄金。

definition: to own exclusively/unique to/specific/there is only
lit. to see only the other rider's dust and have no hope of catching up (idiom)/to be far inferior
to obliterate completely/to vanish from the face of the earth
to count as number one (idiom); second to none/outstanding
reckoned to be first or second best (idiom)/one of the very best/to list one by one
